marketNews.title: Himbara Raises US-Dollar Deposit Counter-Rate to 4% Effective 5 November 2025
marketNews.content: The State-owned Banks Association (Himbara) – consisting of Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), and Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) – announced on Wednesday, 24 September 2025 that they will raise the counter-rate US-dollar deposit interest to 4% per annum effective 5 November 2025. The increase applies to all balance categories and all tenors up to 12 months. The move follows Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa’s statement on Friday, 19 September that the government is preparing a market-based incentive scheme to encourage owners of US-dollar deposits to place their funds domestically, aiming to strengthen the national foreign-exchange reserves, increase the supply of US dollars in the banking system, and facilitate financing of strategic government projects. The policy is expected to support the rupiah, which had depreciated to IDR 16,676 per US$ on Wednesday, 24 September, the weakest level since April 2025. The recent weakening of the rupiah over the past week was mainly driven by negative sentiment regarding (1) the weakening independence of Bank Indonesia and (2) the potential increase in government debt (deficit) to spur economic growth. Meanwhile, the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS) lowered the maximum interest rate on foreign-currency deposits guaranteed at conventional banks by 25 basis points to 2%, and lowered the maximum interest rate on rupiah deposits guaranteed at conventional banks by 25 basis points to 3.5%.

marketNews.title: SSMS to Acquire 63.4% of PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari for IDR 1.6 Trillion
marketNews.content: Sawit Sumbermas Sarana (SSMS) plans to acquire 63.4% of PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari for IDR 1.6 trillion from the current shareholder, PT Citra Borneo Indah. PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari is a palm-oil plantation company operating commercially in Central Kalimantan with an area of 11,046 hectares. SSMS explained that the transaction considers the proximity of the target’s plantations to the company’s existing estates and the young age of the trees, which should boost the company’s productivity. The transaction will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders on 30 October 2025.

marketNews.title: Petrosea Directors Erwin Ciputra and Kartika Hendrawan Purchase PTRO Shares
marketNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) board member and director Erwin Ciputra and director Kartika Hendrawan each purchased 1,000,000 and 200,000 shares of PTRO at IDR 5,425 and IDR 5,675 per share respectively on 22–23 September 2025. The total transaction value is approximately IDR 6.6 billion. After the transaction, Erwin Ciputra’s ownership rose from 0.0898% to 0.0997%, while Kartika Hendrawan’s ownership increased from 0.0172% to 0.0192%.

marketNews.title: Astra Agro Lestari Announces IDR 236.7 Billion Interim Dividend
marketNews.content: Astra Agro Lestari (AALI) announced an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of IDR 236.7 billion, or IDR 123 per share, implying a dividend yield of roughly 1.6% as of Wednesday, 24 September. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 2 October 2025, with payment scheduled for 24 October 2025.

marketNews.title: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama Sells 3.04% of Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC)
marketNews.content: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama transferred 1.67 billion (3.04%) shares of Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC) at an average price of IDR 650 per share on 23 September 2025. The total transaction value is about IDR 1.1 trillion and is classified as a repurchase agreement (repo). After the transaction, PT Tunggal Jaya Investama’s ownership in IMPC fell from 42.15% to 39.11%.

marketNews.title: Suparma Announces 100:30 Interim Share Dividend for FY 2024
marketNews.content: Suparma (SPMA) announced an interim cash dividend for fiscal year 2024 with a 100:30 ratio. The maximum shares to be issued total 946.2 million shares, equivalent to IDR 378.5 billion from undistributed retained earnings. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 7 November 2025, with the share dividend distribution on 25 November 2025.

marketNews.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell Says No Immediate Further Rate Cuts
marketNews.content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, on Tuesday 23 September 2025, rejected expectations of further rate cuts in the coming months, stating that the Fed faces a challenging decision between prioritising inflation control or protecting employment. He reiterated his earlier remarks made when the Fed cut rates the previous week, noting the difficulty of deciding given persistently high US inflation amid a weakening labour market.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Survey Forecasts Further BI Rate Cut to 4.5% and 4.9% 2025-26 Growth
marketNews.content: A Bloomberg September 2025 survey projects that Bank Indonesia will cut the BI Rate by another 25 basis points to 4.5% by the end of 2025, following an unexpected 25-basis-point cut to 4.75% in September 2025. The same survey expects Indonesia’s economy to grow +4.9% YoY in 2025 (vs. +5.03% YoY in 2024) and +4.9% YoY in 2026, slightly above the August 2025 consensus of +4.85% YoY and in line with the 2025 APBN outlook of +4.7-5% YoY. For 2026, the consensus still sees 4.9% YoY growth, below the 2026 APBN target of +5.4% YoY.

marketNews.title: OECD Raises Indonesia 2025-26 Growth Outlook to 4.9% YoY
marketNews.content: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) on Tuesday 23 September 2025 revised its Indonesia growth outlook to +4.9% YoY for 2025 and +4.9% YoY for 2026, higher than the previous June 2025 outlook of +4.7% and +4.8% respectively, though still slightly below the 2024 actual of +5.03% YoY. The OECD said Indonesia’s growth will be supported by monetary easing and strong public investment. The OECD also raised the global growth forecast for 2025 by 0.3 percentage points to 3.2% YoY (2024: +3.3% YoY), while the 2026 forecast remains at +2.9% YoY.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Palm-Oil Export Declines 1.9% MoM in July 2025
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Palm Oil Association reported that Indonesia’s palm-oil exports fell 1.9% month-on-month in July 2025 to about 3.54 million tonnes, while stocks rose 1.5% MoM to about 2.57 million tonnes. Palm-oil production increased 6% MoM in July 2025, whereas domestic consumption fell 1.8% MoM, with biodiesel consumption down 2.7% MoM.

marketNews.title: EU Delays Anti-Deforestation Law Implementation to End-2026
marketNews.content: The European Commission announced on Tuesday 23 September 2025 that it will postpone the implementation of the anti-deforestation regulation by one year to 30 December 2026, citing IT-related issues and supply-chain concerns. The delay still requires approval from EU member states and the European Parliament. The regulation, first postponed in October 2024 to 30 December 2025, would require due-diligence for commodities such as palm oil, beef, soy, coffee, cocoa, wood and rubber.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Pulp Exports Up 13.1% YoY, Paper Exports Up 15% YoY in 7M25
marketNews.content: Liana Bratasida, chair of the Indonesian Pulp and Paper Association, told Kontan on Tuesday 23 September that Indonesia’s pulp exports rose 13.1% YoY to 3.8 million tonnes in the first seven months of 2025, while paper exports increased 15% YoY to 3.4 million tonnes.

marketNews.title: Manulife Asset Management Indonesia to Acquire Schroder Investment Management Indonesia
marketNews.content: Manulife Asset Management Indonesia announced that it will acquire PT Schroder Investment Management Indonesia. The transaction is expected to close after all closing conditions are satisfied. Until full completion, both entities will continue to operate independently and remain fully compliant with all applicable regulations.

marketNews.title: Market-Cap Analogy from bay1922
marketNews.content: “So if EPS, PER, PBV are like report-card grades, Market Cap is like the size of the school: big like a state university or small like a private tutoring centre.” – bay1922 (stockbit.com)

tickerNews.title: SSMS to Acquire 63.4% of PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari for IDR 1.6 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Sawit Sumbermas Sarana (SSMS) plans to acquire 63.4% of PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari for IDR 1.6 trillion from the current shareholder, PT Citra Borneo Indah. The target’s 11,046-hectare plantation in Central Kalimantan is adjacent to SSMS’s existing estates and has relatively young trees, which should boost productivity.

tickerNews.content: Petrosea directors Erwin Ciputra and Kartika Hendrawan each bought 1,000,000 and 200,000 shares of PTRO at IDR 5,425 and IDR 5,675 per share on 22-23 September 2025, respectively. The total transaction value is about IDR 6.6 billion. After the purchases, Erwin Ciputra’s stake rose from 0.0898% to 0.0997% and Kartika Hendrawan’s from 0.0172% to 0.0192%.

tickerNews.title: Astra Agro Lestari Announces IDR 236.7 Billion Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: Astra Agro Lestari (AALI) announced an interim dividend for FY 2025 of IDR 236.7 billion (IDR 123 per share), implying a dividend yield of roughly 1.6% as of Wednesday 24 September. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 2 October 2025, with payment scheduled for 24 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama Sells 3.04% of IMPC
tickerNews.content: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama reduced its holding in Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC) from 42.15% to 39.11% by selling 1.67 billion (3.04%) shares at an average price of IDR 650 per share on 23 September 2025, for a total transaction value of about IDR 1.1 trillion.

tickerNews.title: Suparma Announces 100:30 Interim Share Dividend for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: Suparma (SPMA) announced an interim share dividend for FY 2024 with a 100:30 ratio, maximum 946.2 million shares (IDR 378.5 billion) from undistributed retained earnings. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 7 November 2025, with the share dividend distribution on 25 November 2025.
